main event: On July 8, 1958, an airborne object exhibiting characteristics of an unidentified flying object was sighted over Little Neck, New York.
interesting points: About 20 objects in formation like ducks were observed at night over a short observation length of 3 minutes., The objects were moving southerly from East to Southeast., One observer, Robert C. Gardner, described a large object with white and red/green flashing lights that hovered before moving south., Weather conditions were clear with a full moon and good visibility during the sightings., The case is classified as having insufficient data for evaluation despite previous sightings noted.
sighted object: an airborne object with white and red/green flashing lights
witness description: Robert C. Gardner, Captain in the USAF
